CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 4, 1944, pg. 11 reads: "Mrs. F.D.R. Receives Pittsburghers - During a six-hour stay in Pittsburgh last Friday. Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt met and shook hands with nearly 1,300 Pittsburgh women, in a reception sponsored by the YWCA of the city. in receiving line are Mrs. Roosevelt, Mrs. Robert D. Campbell, president of the YWCA in Pittsburgh; Mrs. L.A. Bellinger of the Centre Avenue branch, prominent AKA soror, and Mrs. Charles R. Miller, Jr.-Harris Photo"Eleanor Roosevelt visited Pittsburgh twice in 1944, once in February and again in May.  This may be the February visit, as one of the women is wearing a fur coat.  Jessie Vann at far left was the widow of Robert L. Vann, publisher of the Pittsburgh Courier.  Following her husband's death in 1940, she was the newspaper's major stockholder until its sale in 1965.
TitMainTitle: Crowd of women, including First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, Mrs. Robert D. Campbell, Mrs. L. A. Bellinger, and Mrs. Charles R. Miller Jr. standing in interior with large ferns and American flag for reception
